name: FetchMarketingCampaignBatches
description:
Retrieve a batch of HubSpot marketing campaigns and assets.

Use this tool to read a batch of marketing campaigns from HubSpot, along with their associated assets. The tool allows for processing up to 50 campaigns per request. Note that the campaigns returned may not be in the order requested, and duplicate campaign IDs will be handled by returning only unique entries.

parameters.name: campaign_batch_inputs
parameters.description: A list of JSON objects, each containing an 'id' key, representing the campaign IDs to fetch. Supports up to 50 campaigns per request.

parameters.name: fetch_start_date
parameters.description: Start date to fetch asset metrics, formatted as YYYY-MM-DD. Determines the period for asset metrics. Optional.

value_schema.description: Start date to fetch asset metrics, formatted as YYYY-MM-DD. This date is used to fetch the metrics associated with the assets for a specified period. If not provided, no asset metrics will be fetched.

parameters.name: end_date_for_asset_metrics
parameters.description: End date to fetch asset metrics, formatted as YYYY-MM-DD. If not provided, no asset metrics will be fetched.

value_schema.description: End date to fetch asset metrics, formatted as YYYY-MM-DD. This date is used to fetch the metrics associated with the assets for a specified period. If not provided, no asset metrics will be fetched.

parameters.name: requested_properties
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of properties to return in the response. Ignored if values are empty, resulting in an empty properties map if not specified.

value_schema.description: A comma-separated list of the properties to be returned in the response. If any of the specified properties has empty value on the requested object(s), they will be ignored and not returned in response. If this parameter is empty, the response will include an empty properties map.

metadata.description: Arcade Starter tools for LLMs to interact directly with the low-level Hubspot Marketing API

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: Start date to fetch asset metrics, formatted as YYYY-MM-DD. This date is used to fetch the metrics associated with the assets for a specified period. If not provided, no asset metrics will be fetched.

value_schema.description: Start date to fetch asset metrics, formatted as YYYY-MM-DD. This date is used to fetch the metrics associated with the assets for a specified period. If not provided, no asset metrics will be fetched.

parameters.name: endDate
parameters.description: End date to fetch asset metrics, formatted as YYYY-MM-DD. This date is used to fetch the metrics associated with the assets for a specified period. If not provided, no asset metrics will be fetched.

value_schema.description: End date to fetch asset metrics, formatted as YYYY-MM-DD. This date is used to fetch the metrics associated with the assets for a specified period. If not provided, no asset metrics will be fetched.

parameters.name: properties
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of the properties to be returned in the response. If any of the specified properties has empty value on the requested object(s), they will be ignored and not returned in response. If this parameter is empty, the response will include an empty properties map.

value_schema.description: A comma-separated list of the properties to be returned in the response. If any of the specified properties has empty value on the requested object(s), they will be ignored and not returned in response. If this parameter is empty, the response will include an empty properties map.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
